title: Ai-Augmented Green Cybersecurity Framework for Sustainable Healthcare Information Systems Aligned with Un Sustainable Development Goals (Sdgs)
affiliations: Lincoln University College, Eudoxia Research University, Muscat University, affiliation not provided to SSRN, Princess Nourah bint Abdulrahman University and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Ai-Augmented Green Cybersecurity Framework for Sustainable Healthcare Information Systems Aligned with Un Sustainable Development Goals (Sdgs)
detail.abstract: The increasing digitization of healthcare infrastructures has introduced new cybersecurity challenges, exacerbated by the growing use of artificial intelligence (AI) systems that often demand high computational resources. While AI-driven intrusion detection offers improved accuracy, its sustainability in resource-constrained medical settings remains a critical concern. To address this, we formalize healthcare cybersecurity as a constrained multi-objective optimization problem, balancing detection accuracy with energy and resource efficiency. This study introduces a novel AI-augmented green cybersecurity framework designed specifically for healthcare information systems, aligning with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), particularly SDG 3 (Good Health and Well-being), SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure), and SDG 12 (Responsible Consumption and Production). The proposed framework incorporates lightweight AI models—Logistic Regression, LightGBM, and a Shallow Autoencoder—to enable effective threat detection with minimal energy consumption. Experiments were conducted on benchmark cybersecurity datasets (NSL-KDD and CICIDS2017), simulating realistic intrusion scenarios. Models were evaluated using traditional metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, AUC-ROC) and green computing proxies (model size, inference time, CPU and memory usage). Results show that LightGBM provides the most favorable trade-off between detection performance and energy efficiency, while Logistic Regression is suitable for deployment on low-resource edge devices. The Shallow Autoencoder demonstrated potential for unsupervised anomaly detection but requires refinement for complex attacks. Overall, this study offers a practical and theoretically grounded architecture for green AI cybersecurity in healthcare, promoting resilience, energy efficiency, and ethical digital health transformation in line with global development goals.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种面向医疗信息系统的绿色网络安全框架，通过轻量级AI模型（Logistic Regression、LightGBM和浅层自编码器）实现高效威胁检测与低能耗的平衡，符合联合国可持续发展目标。实验表明，LightGBM在检测性能与能效间表现最佳。
AI.research_question: 如何在资源受限的医疗环境中实现高效且可持续的AI驱动网络安全？
AI.motivation: 医疗基础设施的数字化和AI系统的广泛应用带来了新的网络安全挑战，尤其是在资源受限的环境中，如何平衡检测精度与能效成为关键问题。
AI.theoretical_framework: 本研究将医疗网络安全问题形式化为一个约束多目标优化问题，结合轻量级AI模型和绿色计算理论。
AI.method: 采用Logistic Regression、LightGBM和浅层自编码器，在NSL-KDD和CICIDS2017数据集上进行实验，评估传统指标和绿色计算指标。
AI.findings: LightGBM在检测性能与能效间表现最佳，Logistic Regression适合低资源边缘设备，浅层自编码器在无监督异常检测中潜力显著但需改进。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一个理论框架，将医疗网络安全问题形式化为多目标优化问题，并验证了轻量级AI模型的可行性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为医疗信息系统提供了一种实用的绿色网络安全架构，支持全球发展目标中的韧性、能效和伦理数字化转型。

title: Navigating Economic Policy Uncertainty Through E-Commerce
affiliations: Nankai University, Nankai University, University of Colorado, Colorado Springs - College of Business and Zhejiang Gongshang University

detail.title: Navigating Economic Policy Uncertainty Through E-Commerce
detail.abstract: Economic policy uncertainty (EPU) has evolved from a transient shock into a persistent feature of the global economy, yet little is known about how firms can reconfigure their business models to mitigate its effects. This paper examines whether firms respond to rising EPU by transforming their business models toward e-commerce. Using high-frequency data from 83,193 firm-product-month observations of Chinese A-share listed firms, we find that EPU significantly accelerates firm e-commerce. A one-standard-deviation increase in EPU corresponds to 14.3% higher e-commerce sales and 7.6% higher sales volume. These positive effects persist under alternative uncertainty measures, IV specifications using U.S. EPU, and controls for COVID-19 and major promotional events. Further, mechanism tests reveal that e-commerce helps firms navigate high EPU by improving liquidity and enabling asset-light operations, as well as reducing transaction costs to boost profitability. Our findings suggest that e-commerce serves not merely as a distribution channel but as a strategic growth option, allowing firms to transform uncertainty into opportunity. This reorientation toward digital business models offers broader implications for firm adaptation in volatile policy environments.

AI.tldr: 本文研究发现，经济政策不确定性（EPU）显著推动企业转向电子商务，提升销售和盈利能力，电子商务成为企业应对不确定性的战略工具。
AI.research_question: 企业是否通过转向电子商务来应对经济政策不确定性（EPU）的上升？
AI.motivation: EPU已成为全球经济的一个持续性特征，但企业如何调整商业模式以应对其影响尚不明确。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于企业应对不确定性的战略调整理论，探讨电子商务作为应对工具的作用。
AI.method: 使用中国A股上市公司的83,193个企业-产品-月度高频数据进行分析。
AI.findings: EPU显著加速企业电子商务转型，提升销售和盈利能力。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了电子商务不仅是分销渠道，更是企业应对不确定性的战略增长选项。
AI.practical_contributions: 为企业提供了在政策波动环境中通过数字化商业模式转型的实践指导。

title: Ecommerce Behavioural Intentions Post-Covid 19 Lockdowns
affiliations: University of the Witwatersrand and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Ecommerce Behavioural Intentions Post-Covid 19 Lockdowns
detail.abstract: This study evaluates the factors influencing online shopping behaviour in South Africa during the COVID-19 lockdowns, with a specific focus on perceived risk, trust, and how consumer behaviour has evolved since the start of the pandemic. A total of 381 South African consumers participated in an online survey, which was structured around the UTAUT2 model and extended to include perceived risk and trust. A confirmatory factor analysis was performed to validate the measurement model, followed by a structural equation model to assess the significance of the factors and their relationship with the dependent variable, behavioural intention. The findings demonstrate that consumers have significantly changed their online shopping behaviour, increasing their use of online shopping during the pandemic, with plans to continue this trend. All nine variables explored in the study were significant to varying degrees, with effort expectancy, performance expectancy, hedonic motivation, and habit showing the strongest correlations. While this research offers an overall view of eCommerce behaviour in South Africa during the lockdown, further studies could consider moderating variables such as age and gender. Additionally, the use of stratified random sampling in future research could provide a more generalised view of consumer behaviour.

AI.tldr: 本研究评估了南非COVID-19封锁期间影响在线购物行为的因素，重点关注感知风险、信任及消费者行为的变化。基于UTAUT2模型扩展的在线调查显示，消费者行为显著改变，且九变量均具不同程度相关性。
AI.research_question: 南非COVID-19封锁期间，哪些因素影响了在线购物行为？
AI.motivation: 探讨疫情下消费者行为的演变及其驱动因素，为电商策略提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: UTAUT2模型，扩展了感知风险和信任变量。
AI.method: 对381名南非消费者进行在线调查，采用验证性因子分析和结构方程模型。
AI.findings: 消费者在线购物行为显著增加，且九变量均具相关性，努力期望、绩效期望、享乐动机和习惯相关性最强。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了UTAUT2模型，验证了感知风险和信任在疫情中的作用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为电商企业提供了疫情期间消费者行为变化的洞察，建议未来研究考虑年龄和性别等调节变量。
